intro: Odontostemma pharense, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Odontostemma pharense is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
